issues.description: The template’s Person.getBirthday() method returns String, but PersonService.save calls person.getBirthday().isAfter(LocalDate.now()), which requires getBirthday() to return a LocalDate. This inconsistency prevents the code from compiling and blocks the core validation logic.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the signature of Person.getBirthday() to return LocalDate (e.g. `public LocalDate getBirthday() { return birthday; }`) so that PersonService.save can correctly call isAfter(...) on the result.

issues.description: The problem statement instructs students to call the REST endpoint at “PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents”, but both the template and solution code define the mapping as "/persons/{personId}/parents" (no "/api" prefix). This mismatch will lead to 404 errors if students follow the problem text literally.
issues.suggested_fix: Either remove the "/api" prefix in the problem description (use "/persons/{personId}/parents") or add a base path "/api" in PersonResource (e.g. change @RequestMapping to @RequestMapping(path = "/api", consumes=…, produces=…) so that endpoints become "/api/persons/…").
